newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Earthquake hits 3 Balkan states, no serious damage.
newsitem.headline: Earthquake hits 3 Balkan states, no serious damage.

text.p: An earthquake measuring from 4.8 to 5.5 on the open-ended Richter scale hit Albania, Macedonia and northern Greece on Friday morning but there were no reports of casualties or major damage.
"We have registered an earthquake of 4.8 degrees on the Richter scale," Albania's earthquake centre director, Betim Muco, said in a statement.
Tremors measuring 5.5 struck the northern Greek towns of Florina, Edessa, Kozani and Kastoria where people rushed panic-stricken out of their homes.

Muco's statement added that the epicentre was in Macedonia between the lakes of Ohrid and Prespa, some 300 km (190 miles) from the Albanian capital Tirana. A number of old houses were damaged near scenic Lake Ohrid.
"It was a medium earthquake," said Albanian specialist Veronika Prifti.
